pros: Overtime when available. Able to work at different locations.
cons: No direct holiday PTO. You have to use your own PTO which has holidays included.

job_title: QA Specialist I in Dallas, TX
pros: Room for advancement, great place to learn and grow, and wonderful lower and middle management.
cons: Terrible work-life balance, project management frustration and difficulties due to poor collaboration and communication between internal departments

pros: All of the providers I worked with at HTPN were very considerate and professional. They just want what's best for the patients.
cons: Management is focused on squeezing every drop of productivity from you as possible, and refuses to backfill positions when people leave.

pros: Great benefits with Baylor Hospitals/ providers
cons: Hard to move up within a clinic

pros: Steady check, some people that care
cons: Integrity or lack thereof, poor leadership, lack of development, lack of direction, no standardization

job_title: Web Production Designer in Dallas, TX
pros: Supportive, well paid, good benefits
cons: for me, distance traveled to the office. bad traffic.

review_title: Worst company I have ever worked with.
pros: Salary is great!  They definitely pay their employees well, but don't get used to it. Their company has the highest turn over rate I have ever witnessed. It's almost like a goal of theirs to see how fast the revolving door can turn. So like I said, don't get used to the salary, you wont be around long enough to enjoy it.
cons: Where to begin?  No organization, horrible communication, employee training is basically nonexistent, Upper management has no idea how to do their jobs so they spend all day calling anyone they can to find out answers. No respect for staff (INCLUDING PHYSICIANS) I have never worked in an environment where the upper management (who are lucky to have a bachelors degree) talk down to Physicians with absolutely no respect. Benefits are a mere suggestion as to what health insurance should be for healthcare workers. I will always recommend people to work for a big corporation, but NOT this one.

review_title: Worked in different offices and same upper managment style in each
pros: I suppose to have a job, that will be filled with disrespectful management style practices that all levels of upper management will support. No matter how in depth and unethical their practices may be, all levels of upper management will support their unethical and unruly behaviors.
cons: Management is knifing.  Managements higher ups will support their managers at all costs.  Hourly employees must participate with management or upper management when needed or positions will be terminated.

pros: HealthTexas is a great place to work.  They really care about their employees and take our feedback seriously.  I love the people I work with and many have been at HealthTexas a long time.  We are a true family and our work in taking care of patients is very meaningful.  HealthTexas has strong values and culture, which one cannot find just anywhere.
cons: The organization is growing at a very fast pace and sometimes hard to keep up with all the new initiatives, people and locations.

pros: There are some great folks who work for the organization.  Unfortunately the pesticide is ruining the crops at the moment.
cons: HealthTexas champions those who don’t rock the boat.  Management and the corporate structure operates very much like a fraternity or sorority.  If you are in, you are golden and can do no wrong even if In fact you do everything wrong.  Who you know is far more relevant than what you know in this organization.  The result is that the company is on a downward spiral and is working hard to disprove the theory that the company is too big to fail.

pros: Great people!!! I really love their mission, but they seem to care more about their patients than their employees (not entirely a bad thing).
cons: Less than standard vacation days, less than standard paid holidays. Strict adherence to policies allowed for very little time away from office. They pride themselves on "running lean." Translation: they will work you to death.

pros: Best work environment that I have worked at ever. I love going to work. Company is growing fast. There are lots of opportunity to learn and grow. Non profit company that you feel great being a part of.
cons: Fast moving and nimble company. People tend to stay very long compared to other companies that I have worked at. Non profit so pay is comparable to other NP.

review_title: Great patient centered company to work for!
job_title: Manager of Advanced Practice Providers in Dallas, TX
pros: HTPN places the highest value on treating our patients as people and providing them with high quality care.  This attitude is shared throughout the leadership and staff. Great collaboration on teams as we aspire to be innovative in the healthcare arena.
cons: Fast growth can cause some challenges in redesigning to accommodate but great issue to have!  Thankfully management is able to adjust and being a part of a large healthcare system provides many opportunities and resources.

pros: I enjoy the people that I work with on a daily basis and feel that I am valued. The people that I work with are very helpful, encouraging, and make teamwork a priority. HTPN is growing rapidly and continues to open up new opportunities for employees.
cons: Due to rapid growth, at times we are functioning without enough staff; however, leadership sees this and is working to remedy this situation.

job_title: Physician Office Representative in Dallas, TX
pros: Great group of providers. Perks that physicians provide are gracious and generous. Management makes you feel you are valued and an asset to the company.
cons: Company benefits could be much better. Using benefits at your own facility for our benefits plan doesn’t prove as usual or cost effective as one would think.

pros: Nice office  great patients
cons: management cares  more about  making sure  they  make more while their physicians  continue  to make less and work  harder

pros: HTPN offers many career opportunities.
cons: HTPN is an ok company to work for I just wish that they weren't so strict on their employees. Not much care for time off when it is needed for health reasons for employees.

pros: Excellent opportunities for employment and growth.
cons: I personally don't have any.

pros: Small office with great team and NO DRAMA!
cons: Monday thru Friday 8:30-5p after leaving 7p-7a  3 days a week is hard to do but I manage.

review_title: This has been a horrific experience.
job_title: Physician Office Representative in Grand Prairie, TX
pros: I got 3 months experience as a medical assistant at my current position. I learned new procedures and information about different medications.
cons: My manager is a horrible person she has hindered me from transferring to a different clinic. I feel that I am targeted each day at work.

pros: Location, job duties, positive environment
cons: pay, opportunity of advancement, can be understaffed

pros: Very organized and there is a good system in place.
cons: Their communication skills are not that great.
